only.0: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

information.2: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

information.3: These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

when.0:
When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.
            Please visit our Use of Cookies and other Technologies Notice for more information.

agreement.0: HP’s BCR for Controller is a corporate privacy compliance framework made up of a binding agreement, business processes and policies, training and guidelines which has been approved by the Data Protection Authorities of most EU Member States.

law.0: HP’s BCR for Processor is a corporate privacy compliance framework approved by the Data Protection Authorities of most EU Member States. It allows HP to move customer data worldwide through HP companies in compliance with EU data protection law.

we.0: Your personal information may be collected, used, disclosed, or otherwise processed by HP for the purposes of managing your relationship with HP and to better serve you by personalizing your experience and interaction with us.Details about what categories and pieces of personal information we collect about you, how we use the information we collect, where and from whom we obtain it, to whom we disclose, sell, or share your personal information, your respective State rights regarding it, and how you can exercise your rights can be found in our HP US Privacy Statement. Throughout this document references to “we,” “us,” “our,” and “Company” refer to HP branded companies and current and future affiliates (herein "HP").

we.1: As described in our US Privacy Statement, you have the following rights in relation to how we use your information and the manner in which we process it (as provided for in the local law). This includes:

we.2: A right to access the personal information that we collect, use, disclose, or otherwise process from you.

we.3: A right to know what personal information we collect, use, disclose, share, sell, or otherwise process about you; the categories of sources of such information; the purposes for processing your personal information; and the categories of third parties with whom we disclose your personal information.

we.4: A right to delete the personal information that we collect or otherwise process from you (with specified exceptions for operational and legal necessity).

we.5: A right to update, amend, correct, or rectify inaccurate or incomplete personal information we maintain about you.

we.6: A right to obtain information about financial incentives that we offer to you, if any.

we.7: How We Manage your Privacy Requests

we.8: Upon receipt of your communication, our representative will contact you within a reasonable time to respond to your questions or concerns. In some cases, we may request further information to verify your identity, complete your request, ask for the service your request refers to, clarify the nature of your request, remedy any deficiencies with your request, or let you know if we need more time, as permitted in applicable law. Please refrain from sending us sensitive personal information.

we.9: You can designate someone else to make a request on your behalf. To protect your information, we will ask for a signed permission from you authorizing the other person to submit a request on your behalf. If applicable, we will contact you to confirm that you have provided the authorized agent permission to submit the request before we respond to your authorized agent’s request.

we.10: We will acknowledge receipt of your request within 10 days after we receive your request. You will receive our response to your request within 45 days of your request, unless we provide you with notice that it will take more than 45 days to respond (in that case, we won't take more than 90 days to respond).

we.11: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Virginia, Utah, Florida, Oregon, Texas, and Montana privacy laws permit their respective residents to request us to stop selling or sharing their personal information with third parties. If you are resident from such states, this section applies to any personal information that we collect about you in accordance with your respective state's privacy laws.

we.12: Opt-out in Cookie Preference Center: As a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Virginia, Utah, Florida,  Oregon, Texas, or Montana resident, in addition to being able to select your preference on which cookies are allowed, you can Opt-out of sale or sharing browsing based personal data by clicking on the “Privacy Preference Center” and changing the setting to “inactive” (by changing the setting to GREY slider) at the “Sell or Share” category. If you choose “inactive”, we will not be able to offer you personalized ads and will not sell or share your personal data with third parties as defined by relevant law. Before selecting “Inactive” at the “Sell or Share” category at the Privacy Preference Center, make sure all cookies have been cleared from your browser.

we.13: Universal Opt-out Mechanism (e.g., Global Privacy Control): If you use a Universal Opt-out Mechanism or Opt-out Preference Signal (as defined in applicable law), including a web browser or extension, we will interpret as Opting-out of the sale or sharing of your personal information with third parties that are in scope of Do Not Sell or Share. Please note that the use of Universal Opt-out mechanism only applies to your browsing activity and not to offline sale or sharing of personal information.

we.14: We are committed to process your Opt-out preferences (and as a result, opt out of personalized advertising) for the device and web browser from which the Opt-out signal is being made, as it will be tied to a specific device ID or browser ID. If you use another device or browser, you will need to Opt-out on each device and browser. If you block or clear cookies from your browser, it may remove the Opt-out settings, requiring you to Opt-out again. If you wish to Opt-out, we recommend that you clear your cookies from your browser first and then select your cookie preferences above. Even when Opted-out, you may still see contextual ads online such as those based on the topic and content of a webpage you visit.

we.15: We aim to ensure that your concerns are resolved in a timely and appropriate manner. If we fail to take any action regarding your request to exercise rights or decline to respond, you have the right to appeal, as permitted in local law. You can appeal directly or through an authorized agent using our HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form. The appeal must describe your request with a detailed summary that allows us to properly understand, evaluate, and respond to it and provide the former case ticket number. Similarly, in case an appeal is denied, you have the right to contact your local Attorney General or dedicated Agency, where applicable, if you have concerns about the result of the appeal, as prescribed by applicable law.

we.16: If we modify this Privacy Choices Notice, we will post the revised disclosure here, with an updated revision date. If we make significant changes to this Privacy Choices Notice that materially alter our methods by which you can exercise your rights request, or as otherwise required by local law, we may also notify you by other means, such as sending an email or posting a notice on our corporate website and/or social media pages prior to the changes taking effect.

information.0: This Privacy Choices Notice is intended for a United States audience and supplements the HP US Privacy Statement. It informs you of the rights you can exercise in relation to your personal information, including information that may be collected from your online activity, use of devices, and interactions you have with HP offline, such as when you engage with our customer support representatives.

information.2: As described in our US Privacy Statement, you have the following rights in relation to how we use your information and the manner in which we process it (as provided for in the local law). This includes:

information.3: A right to access the personal information that we collect, use, disclose, or otherwise process from you.

information.4: A right to know what personal information we collect, use, disclose, share, sell, or otherwise process about you; the categories of sources of such information; the purposes for processing your personal information; and the categories of third parties with whom we disclose your personal information.

information.5: A right to delete the personal information that we collect or otherwise process from you (with specified exceptions for operational and legal necessity).

information.6: A right to update, amend, correct, or rectify inaccurate or incomplete personal information we maintain about you.

information.7: A right to limit HP’s use and disclosure of sensitive personal information about you for a specific HP purpose (if any, and as permitted by applicable law).

information.14: Obtaining Information about the Sale or Sharing of your Personal Information

information.15: You can request and obtain from us further information regarding those categories of third parties to whom your personal information was disclosed, sold, or shared (if any, and as defined under applicable law), the purposes for collecting, selling, or sharing your personal information, and the categories of personal information disclosed, sold or shared, as provided for in the local law. To make such a request, please contact us by using the HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form..

if.1: A right to obtain information about financial incentives that we offer to you, if any.

if.2: You can request us to stop selling or sharing your personal information outside of your browsing activity by using the “Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information Request” form. To exercise your rights, or if you have any questions or concerns about our US Privacy Statement and our privacy practices, our collection and use of your information or a possible data breach, you can, or by entrusting an authorized agent, contact us by using our  HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form, or by writing to us at the address below:

if.3: Upon receipt of your communication, our representative will contact you within a reasonable time to respond to your questions or concerns. In some cases, we may request further information to verify your identity, complete your request, ask for the service your request refers to, clarify the nature of your request, remedy any deficiencies with your request, or let you know if we need more time, as permitted in applicable law. Please refrain from sending us sensitive personal information.

if.4: You can designate someone else to make a request on your behalf. To protect your information, we will ask for a signed permission from you authorizing the other person to submit a request on your behalf. If applicable, we will contact you to confirm that you have provided the authorized agent permission to submit the request before we respond to your authorized agent’s request.

if.5: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Virginia, Utah, Florida, Oregon, Texas, and Montana privacy laws permit their respective residents to request us to stop selling or sharing their personal information with third parties. If you are resident from such states, this section applies to any personal information that we collect about you in accordance with your respective state's privacy laws.

if.6: You can request and obtain from us further information regarding those categories of third parties to whom your personal information was disclosed, sold, or shared (if any, and as defined under applicable law), the purposes for collecting, selling, or sharing your personal information, and the categories of personal information disclosed, sold or shared, as provided for in the local law. To make such a request, please contact us by using the HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form..

if.7: If applicable, profiling in furtherance of automated decisions that produce legal or similarly significant effects concerning you.

if.8: Opt-out in Cookie Preference Center: As a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Virginia, Utah, Florida,  Oregon, Texas, or Montana resident, in addition to being able to select your preference on which cookies are allowed, you can Opt-out of sale or sharing browsing based personal data by clicking on the “Privacy Preference Center” and changing the setting to “inactive” (by changing the setting to GREY slider) at the “Sell or Share” category. If you choose “inactive”, we will not be able to offer you personalized ads and will not sell or share your personal data with third parties as defined by relevant law. Before selecting “Inactive” at the “Sell or Share” category at the Privacy Preference Center, make sure all cookies have been cleared from your browser.

if.9: Universal Opt-out Mechanism (e.g., Global Privacy Control): If you use a Universal Opt-out Mechanism or Opt-out Preference Signal (as defined in applicable law), including a web browser or extension, we will interpret as Opting-out of the sale or sharing of your personal information with third parties that are in scope of Do Not Sell or Share. Please note that the use of Universal Opt-out mechanism only applies to your browsing activity and not to offline sale or sharing of personal information.

if.10: We are committed to process your Opt-out preferences (and as a result, opt out of personalized advertising) for the device and web browser from which the Opt-out signal is being made, as it will be tied to a specific device ID or browser ID. If you use another device or browser, you will need to Opt-out on each device and browser. If you block or clear cookies from your browser, it may remove the Opt-out settings, requiring you to Opt-out again. If you wish to Opt-out, we recommend that you clear your cookies from your browser first and then select your cookie preferences above. Even when Opted-out, you may still see contextual ads online such as those based on the topic and content of a webpage you visit.

if.11: We aim to ensure that your concerns are resolved in a timely and appropriate manner. If we fail to take any action regarding your request to exercise rights or decline to respond, you have the right to appeal, as permitted in local law. You can appeal directly or through an authorized agent using our HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form. The appeal must describe your request with a detailed summary that allows us to properly understand, evaluate, and respond to it and provide the former case ticket number. Similarly, in case an appeal is denied, you have the right to contact your local Attorney General or dedicated Agency, where applicable, if you have concerns about the result of the appeal, as prescribed by applicable law.

if.12: If we modify this Privacy Choices Notice, we will post the revised disclosure here, with an updated revision date. If we make significant changes to this Privacy Choices Notice that materially alter our methods by which you can exercise your rights request, or as otherwise required by local law, we may also notify you by other means, such as sending an email or posting a notice on our corporate website and/or social media pages prior to the changes taking effect.

if.13: These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

if.14: These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages.If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

if.15: These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites.If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

when.0: This Privacy Choices Notice is intended for a United States audience and supplements the HP US Privacy Statement. It informs you of the rights you can exercise in relation to your personal information, including information that may be collected from your online activity, use of devices, and interactions you have with HP offline, such as when you engage with our customer support representatives.

when.1: We are committed to process your Opt-out preferences (and as a result, opt out of personalized advertising) for the device and web browser from which the Opt-out signal is being made, as it will be tied to a specific device ID or browser ID. If you use another device or browser, you will need to Opt-out on each device and browser. If you block or clear cookies from your browser, it may remove the Opt-out settings, requiring you to Opt-out again. If you wish to Opt-out, we recommend that you clear your cookies from your browser first and then select your cookie preferences above. Even when Opted-out, you may still see contextual ads online such as those based on the topic and content of a webpage you visit.

when.2:
When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.
            Please visit our Use of Cookies and other Technologies Notice for more information.

when.3: These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. we collect.0: Your personal information may be collected, used, disclosed, or otherwise processed by HP for the purposes of managing your relationship with HP and to better serve you by personalizing your experience and interaction with us.Details about what categories and pieces of personal information we collect about you, how we use the information we collect, where and from whom we obtain it, to whom we disclose, sell, or share your personal information, your respective State rights regarding it, and how you can exercise your rights can be found in our HP US Privacy Statement. Throughout this document references to “we,” “us,” “our,” and “Company” refer to HP branded companies and current and future affiliates (herein "HP").

we collect.1: A right to access the personal information that we collect, use, disclose, or otherwise process from you.

we collect.2: A right to know what personal information we collect, use, disclose, share, sell, or otherwise process about you; the categories of sources of such information; the purposes for processing your personal information; and the categories of third parties with whom we disclose your personal information.

we collect.3: A right to delete the personal information that we collect or otherwise process from you (with specified exceptions for operational and legal necessity).

we collect.4: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Virginia, Utah, Florida, Oregon, Texas, and Montana privacy laws permit their respective residents to request us to stop selling or sharing their personal information with third parties. request.3: We will acknowledge receipt of your request within 10 days after we receive your request. You will receive our response to your request within 45 days of your request, unless we provide you with notice that it will take more than 45 days to respond (in that case, we won't take more than 90 days to respond).

third-party.0: Most browsers automatically accept cookies (including some of our third-party analytics providers), but this is typically something you can adjust. Please reference your browser’s settings to adjust your privacy preferences.

third party.0: First Party vs Third Party Cookies...

third party.1: These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages.If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

advertising.0: Targeted advertising, cross-context behavioral advertising, or personalized advertising as defined by law in your jurisdiction;

advertising.1: We are committed to process your Opt-out preferences (and as a result, opt out of personalized advertising) for the device and web browser from which the Opt-out signal is being made, as it will be tied to a specific device ID or browser ID. If you use another device or browser, you will need to Opt-out on each device and browser. If you block or clear cookies from your browser, it may remove the Opt-out settings, requiring you to Opt-out again. If you wish to Opt-out, we recommend that you clear your cookies from your browser first and then select your cookie preferences above. Even when Opted-out, you may still see contextual ads online such as those based on the topic and content of a webpage you visit.

advertising.2: These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites.If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

improve.0: These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

data.0: HP will not discriminate against you for exercising your rights and choices, although some of the functionality and features available on HP Services may change or no longer be available to you as the data might be necessary to provide some functionalities or features.

data.1: HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form

data.2: HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form.

data.3: As a Consumer, you have the right to Opt-out, this means you the right to direct HP to not sell or share personal data about you to third parties, as defined by local law, or to stop doing so for the following purposes:

data.4: Opt-out in Cookie Preference Center: As a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Virginia, Utah, Florida,  Oregon, Texas, or Montana resident, in addition to being able to select your preference on which cookies are allowed, you can Opt-out of sale or sharing browsing based personal data by clicking on the “Privacy Preference Center” and changing the setting to “inactive” (by changing the setting to GREY slider) at the “Sell or Share” category. If you choose “inactive”, we will not be able to offer you personalized ads and will not sell or share your personal data with third parties as defined by relevant law. Before selecting “Inactive” at the “Sell or Share” category at the Privacy Preference Center, make sure all cookies have been cleared from your browser.

data.5: HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form.

we process.0: As described in our US Privacy Statement, you have the following rights in relation to how we use your information and the manner in which we process it (as provided for in the local law). This includes:

collected.0: This Privacy Choices Notice is intended for a United States audience and supplements the HP US Privacy Statement. It informs you of the rights you can exercise in relation to your personal information, including information that may be collected from your online activity, use of devices, and interactions you have with HP offline, such as when you engage with our customer support representatives.

collected.1: Your personal information may be collected, used, disclosed, or otherwise processed by HP for the purposes of managing your relationship with HP and to better serve you by personalizing your experience and interaction with us.Details about what categories and pieces of personal information we collect about you, how we use the information we collect, where and from whom we obtain it, to whom we disclose, sell, or share your personal information, your respective State rights regarding it, and how you can exercise your rights can be found in our HP US Privacy Statement. Throughout this document references to “we,” “us,” “our,” and “Company” refer to HP branded companies and current and future affiliates (herein "HP").

settings.3:
When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.
            Please visit our Use of Cookies and other Technologies Notice for more information.

to protect.0: You can designate someone else to make a request on your behalf. To protect your information, we will ask for a signed permission from you authorizing the other person to submit a request on your behalf. If applicable, we will contact you to confirm that you have provided the authorized agent permission to submit the request before we respond to your authorized agent’s request.

understand.0: We aim to ensure that your concerns are resolved in a timely and appropriate manner. If we fail to take any action regarding your request to exercise rights or decline to respond, you have the right to appeal, as permitted in local law. You can appeal directly or through an authorized agent using our HP’s Privacy Office and Data Protection Officer form. The appeal must describe your request with a detailed summary that allows us to properly understand, evaluate, and respond to it and provide the former case ticket number. Similarly, in case an appeal is denied, you have the right to contact your local Attorney General or dedicated Agency, where applicable, if you have concerns about the result of the appeal, as prescribed by applicable law.

You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.
